Description: Fineware eggshell kaolinite pottery cup (Ware W26) with a rounded spot base and convex sides, wall thickness 2mm. Given a thin cream slip and decorated with rows of impressed motifs between two brown painted bands one 4mm below the rim and one nearly at the base. Motifs consist of repeated ankh-signs and a set of three triangles arranged in a triangular shape. Adams Type A12 (1986, fig. 19).
